title.rendered: Boy (9) commits suicide over ‘Minecraft’ – how dangerous is the online game?

content.rendered:
He was not allowed to play in the online group

A nine-year-old boy took his own life because friends wouldn’t let him play the online computer game ‘Minecraft’. The boy from Hattingen in North Rhine-Westphalia hanged himself. How dangerous is Minecraft for our children? What kind of game is this, and above all: What do parents have to pay particular attention to? We have important tips for you.

Minecraft players create their own world

There is no shooting in Minecraft, and there is no blood. Instead, the Minecraft player can create their own worlds. The role-playing game is considered pedagogically valuable. But why would someone kill themselves because of this? We tried the game and found that it is really easy to get in touch with other users. “Especially when you know the users, you can very quickly feel left out if they don’t communicate with you,” says RTL reporter Caroline Gall.

Is Minecraft a network for pedophiles?

Minecraft made headlines in June 2016 when a pedophile contacted a 12-year-old via the chat function and kidnapped him. “There are very young children out there. And that’s exactly what pedosexuals are often looking for,” says journalist Beate Krafft-Schöning, who specializes in the subject of “sexual violence against children on the Internet.”

In order to protect their child on the Internet, parents should above all ensure that they never lose contact with their child, never leave them alone on the Internet and always pay attention to how they are doing, explains psychologist Dr. Catherine Ohana.

You can find out more tips and what the computer company ‘Microsoft’ says about the suicide of the nine-year-old in the video.

You can find help with suicidal thoughts here

Do you have thoughts about taking your own life or are you worried about a loved one? Try talking to other people about it! This can be friends or relatives. But there is also the possibility to talk anonymously with other people about your thoughts. This can be done by phone, chat, email or in person. At frnd.de you will find an overview of the offers of help. If you need help quickly, you can call the free hotline 0800-1110111 or 0800-1110222 to find people who can show you ways out of difficult situations.
